title.native: キューティクル探偵因幡

description:
In a world where half-human, half-animal chimeras live and work alongside normal people, there are sure to be a few bad apples in the bunch. Unfortunately, half-human criminals means non-human clues that often leave the police stumped. That's where lone wolf detectives like Hiroshi Inaba come in. He's literally part wolf and has the amazing ability to extract critical information just by examining or tasting a sample of someone's hair! Of course, that ability has also resulted in Inaba having a little bit of a hair fetish, but that doesn't seem to be a problem for his two assistants. (Well, at least the cross-dressing one isn't complaining much.) And it's nothing compared to the strange tastes of Inaba's nemesis, the omnivorous (and half goat) crime boss Don Valentino, who has an appetite for green legal tender instead of tender young greens! Inaba's sworn to cut Valentino out of the criminal flock before the Don can wolf down more ill-gotten dough, but he's going to have to chew his way through a lot of evidence to get his goat. Can sheer dogged detective work put the baaaaad guys behind bars?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

name.native: 森 マサシ / フォレスト

node.description:
__Height:__ 173 cm 

[Profile](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11470) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MY_MURMUR) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/j.suwabe/)

Won Best Song at the 6th Seiyuu Awards (2012) for "ST☆RISH" (shared with Takuma Terashima, Kenichi Suzumura, Kishou Taniyama, Mamoru Miyano, Hiro Shimono) in _Uta no☆Prince-sama♪ Maji Love 1000%_. Won Best Supporting Actor at the 7th Seiyuu Awards (2013).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Radio DJ - Kamen Rider Kuuga (TV Series)
- Artem Wing - Tears of Themis (VG)
- Jenua - Epic Seven (VG)
- Dekotorade - Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger (TV Series)
- McBurn - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

[Profile](https://mausu.net/talent/okawa-toru.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tōru_Ōkawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大川透)

He is an actor, voice actor and narrator. He is currently affiliated with Mausu Promotion. He is a Hanshin Tigers fan. His "Kojirou" alias is not to be confused with [Akito Sakuragi](https://anilist.co/staff/125572)'s alias (they have different kanji at the end).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sna72860) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村誠_(脚本家%29)

Affiliated with [Frontier Works](https://anilist.co/studio/61/).

Initially he was mainly a scriptwriter for radio programs, but ever since his involvement on [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/144/) in 2002, he has been working on animation-related projects as both scriptwriter and producer.

In 2010, he made his directorial debut with the puppet animation [Cheburashka](https://anilist.co/anime/9340/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [either](https://anilist.co/staff/134789/) of [the two](https://anilist.co/staff/265458/) animators._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E7%A7%80%E9%9B%84_(%E9%9F%B3%E9%9F%BF%E7%9B%A3%E7%9D%A3%29)

Hideo Takahashi is a sound director.
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

Episode 8 - Sasaki Yuuta Kidnapping Case \ Inaba Family Breakdown Case (Part One)
Episode 9 - Inaba Family Breakdown Case (Part Two) \ Love Flag Jumble Case
Episode 10 - Goat Park Revelry Case\ Don Power Spot Conspiracy Case
Episode 12 - The Cuticle Phantom Thief Appears Case \ Evil Organization Expansion Case
